data.title: New Balance CoCo CG1 Tennis Shoe Review | Tennis Express
data.description: There is one WTA tour player with a signature shoe, and it is Coco Gauff. The young star plays a brilliant backcourt style of tennis with incredible defense, but has also proven to be a threat on the doubles court. The New Balance shoe features a basketball style mid-top design, which locks the heel in place nicely. The CG1 is designed to hold up to the needs of aggressive movers, and athletes that leave it all out there on the court.Shop the New Balance Coco CG1 at Tennis Express: https://www.tennisexpress.com/new-balance-tennis-shoes

data.author: Sabuni Khwa Sabuni
data.title: Kenya Junior Tennis team win bronze at Africa Tennis championships
data.description: Kenya won bronze at the concluded International Tennis Federation (ITF)/Confederation of African Tennis (CAT) at the African Junior competition in Maputo, Mozambique. The team made up of Seline Ahoya, Nancy Kawira and Liya Gikunda defeated Mozambique 3-0 for bronze. They started with a 3-0 loss to Tunisia, went ahead to beat Ghana 2-1 and Namibia […]

data.description: Junior double Wimbledon champion Angela Okuotoyi will give the International Tennis Federation (ITF) Women’s World Tennis Tour W15 Monastir as she prepares for W15 Nairobi set for next month. The reigning Kenya junior champion is set to compete at the W15 Nairobi tournaments at the Karen Country Club slated for November 14-20 and November 21-27 […]

data.author: Reuters
data.title: Tennis-Rubin comes up short in tennis, ready to walk tall in pickleball
data.description: Noah Rubin has been unable to hit the heights expected of him since winning junior Wimbledon in 2014 and the American says he has decided to swap his racket for a paddle to explore a career in the fast-growing sport of pickleball. Rubin, who stands 1.75m tall, said last month that he would take an […]

data.author: Kommentar von Jürgen Schmieder, New York
data.title: Deutsches Tennis: Es kommt zu viel weg
data.description: Zum ersten Mal seit 1984 erreichte kein deutscher Mann die zweite Runde bei den US Open - bei den Frauen siegte lediglich Jule Niemeier. Ein Blick in andere Länder zeigt, dass es Möglichkeiten gäbe, daran etwas zu ändern.

data.author: Sebastian Kayser
data.title: So wird Berlin zur Tennis-Hauptstadt
data.description: Tennis und Berlin – 2020 gab es die Wiedergeburt mit zwei Einladungsturnieren für Frauen und Männer im Steffi-Graf-Stadion an der Hundekehle. Seit 2021 gibt es die Bett1 Open und 2024 kommt der Laver-Cup, wo Europa gegen den Rest der Welt spielt. Folgt nun sogar der Davis Cup?

data.author: SZ Redaktion
data.title: Tennis: Diese Damen sind unschlagbar
data.description: Fünf Spiele, fünf Siege – die Tennis-Damen 30 der Spielgemeinschaft Beckingen/Nalbach waren in diesem Jahr einfach unschlagbar und haben souverän die Meisterschaft in der Saarlandliga errungen. In der kommenden Saison wird die Mannschaft nun in der Oberliga aufschlagen.

data.author: Ashley Chase
data.title: Video of the Day: Tennis tantrum
data.description: s player Nick Kyrgios destroyed a pair of tennis rackets after his loss to Russian Karen Khachanov at the U.S. Open on Wednesday, Sept. 6. Kyrgios wrecked another racket back in March after a loss to Rafael Nadal in the BNP Paribas Open.

data.title: Federer retiring from tennis
data.description: Roger Federer will retire from tennis after next week's Laver Cup, aged 41.

data.title: Was this tennis player poisoned at Wimbledon?
data.description: Britain's Metropolitan Police has revealed it is investigating claims that a female tennis player was deliberately poisoned during this year's Wimbledon.
